intro: Cybianthus ptariensis, commonly known as the Sardinian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sardinia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Cybianthus ptariensis is a rare and endemic species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
